Key Match Events: Giorgi Loria was shown a red card near the end of the first half.
Giorgi Mamardashvili saved Greece's first effort from Anastasios Bakasetas in the shootout.
Giorgos Giakoumakis sent Greece's fourth penalty past the post.
Nika Kvekveskiri converted his spot kick in the shootout to send Georgia through to the finals.
Georges Mikautadze missed his spot kick in the shootout, giving Greece renewed hope.
Konstantinos Mavropanos hit the bar with a header in extra time.
Zuriko Davitashvili's close-range effort was saved by Odysseas Vlachodimos in extra time.
Pre-Game Insights: Georgia's manager Willy Sagnol made one change from the Luxembourg win, with key forward Khvicha Kvaratskhelia returning from suspension.
Greece's Gus Poyet named the same side after the 5-0 thrashing of Kazakhstan in their semi-final.
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia talisman Khvicha Kvaratskhelia said, 'Some did not believe in us but now they will believe it. We are happy. I have never had such an emotion in my life.'
Georgia's manager Willy Sagnol praised the team's performance, saying 'Thanks to the Georgian fans.'
Georgia's talisman Khvicha Kvaratskhelia said, 'I've played in many stadiums but I haven't seen such support anywhere. You were the most important factor.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a scrappy, nervy affair, with chances in normal time few and far between.
Fouls on Kvaratskhelia led to three bookings for Greek defenders in the first half.
Georgia will be in Group F alongside Portugal, Turkey and Czech Republic at the Euros in Germany which begin on June 14.
Greece were European champions in 2004 but their last appearance in a major tournament was at the 2014 World Cup.
Others: The home crowd displayed a banner before the game which read 'Breaking news, Georgia make history' and, in the end, they could wave it proudly when Kvekveskiri's decisive penalty hit the back of the net to send their team to Germany.
